COMMENTS: 14day quarantine for high risk countries including mainland China, South Korea, Iran, Italy. Also for travelers with COVID-19 symptoms.

MEASURE: Health screenings in airports and border crossings
COMMENTS: Health screenings at airports for COVID-19 symptoms, travelers with symptoms have to quarantine for 14 days
All international passenger flights until at least April 3.  Only cargo flights and boats will be permitted entry.
Until April 17
Gathering of more than 20 people are banned.

All travelers entering the DRC who have a fever will be tested, and any persons positive for COVID-19 will be hospitalized at DRC government expense. Both categories will be subject to a mandatory 14-day quarantine.  All persons traveling domestically from Kinshasa to other provinces will be subject to preventative screening.
Bars, cafe and restaurants are closed until further notice.
All borders are closed except trade transportation.
Domestic travels between Kinshasa and the rest of the country are forbidden. Does not apply to trade.
Public gathering are not allowed in the streets.

All residents of Kinshasa, apart from essential workers such as medical staff, would have to stay at home for four days minimum. Update 03/04/2020, the measure has been postponed but is expected to be implemented for 14 days.
The Gombe neighborhood of Kinshasa, as well as the city of Goma, are under a 14-day confinement until April 20.
Religious gathering are forbidden until 17th of April.

MEASURE: Amendments to funeral and burial regulations
COMMENTS: Funerals must happen directly at the morgue, and with a limited number of people.
Sport activities in stadium and other sport halls are suspended.
Partial lockdown of Kinshasa is delayed to a later date.

MEASURE: Requirement to wear protective gear in public
COMMENTS: Requirement to wear face masks in public spaces. The police will issue fines of 5000 Congolese Franc ($3) if masks are not worn.
Confinment of the Gombe neighborhood of Kinshasa will be slowy phased out, with local checkpoints remaining in place.
Neighborhoods around Gombe will be subject to increased health screening.

ADMIN_LEVEL_NAME: Lubumbashi, Goma, Beni, Butembo and Bukavu
COMMENTS: Cities of Lubumbashi, Goma, Beni, Butembo et Bukavu are under quarantine.
Curfew in Lualaba and Lubumbashi from 10pm to 5am.

MEASURE: Requirement to wear protective gear in public
COMMENTS: Wearing facemasks is mandatory in South Kivu.
Self-isolation for people at risk (over 60 or with existing health issues) is mandatory in South Kivu.
Internal travel between the towns of Goma, Beni and Butembo in eastern DRC has been suspended with the exception of cargo
The mineral-rich province of Haut-Katanga begins a 24-hour lockdown to help authorities contact trace.
Checkpoints are set up all around Kinshasa to ensure domestic travel ban is respected.
School closure extended until further notice.
Extension of religious gathering suspension until further notice.
Extension of international flight suspensions until further notice.
Partial reopening of the border with Zambia.

MEASURE: Requirement to wear protective gear in public
COMMENTS: Mandatory use of face mask in Matadi (Congo Central Province).

MEASURE: Requirement to wear protective gear in public
COMMENTS: Mandatory use of face mask in Lubumbashi (Haut-Katanga Province).
Matadi will be under partial lockdown from the 22nd to the 25th of May.
The city of Goma will be under confinement for 14 days, effective May 20.
A curfew will be enforced within the city of Goma between 8 pm and 5 am. Movements within the city between 5 am and 8 pm appear to be permitted.
Travel in and out of Goma at city limits will be restricted for 14 days. Movements within the city between 5 am and 8 pm appear to be permitted.
